page.title: 04Mill Warden, Houghton
page.content: The Warden has worked with the National Trust for three years and likes working at the Mill. The qualifications he needs for this job are, understanding the mill and enjoying meeting people. His job involves looking after the building, selling tickets, making sure that everything is clean and looking at membership cards. The last time the mill actually worked was 55 years ago, in 1930, when it ground 9 tons a day. The present mill was built in the 17th century and they hope to have it working again soon. Instead of the water wheel turning it they will use electric motors. There were 8,000 visitors last year. The public like the mill and would like to see a real water wheel but this would cost Â£100,000.
